roboguice.util
Class SafeAsyncTask<ResultT>

java.lang.Object
  roboguice.util.SafeAsyncTask<ResultT>
Type Parameters:
ResultT -
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.concurrent.Callable<ResultT>
Direct Known Subclasses:
RoboAsyncTask
public abstract class SafeAsyncTask<ResultT>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.concurrent.Callable<ResultT>

A class similar but unrelated to android's AsyncTask. Unlike AsyncTask, this class properly propagates exceptions. If you're familiar with AsyncTask and are looking for AsyncTask.doInBackground(Object[]), we've named it Callable.call() here to conform with java 1.5's Callable interface. Current limitations: does not yet handle progress, although it shouldn't be hard to add.

postToUiThreadAndWait

protected void postToUiThreadAndWait(java.util.concurrent.Callable c)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Posts the specified runnable to the UI thread using a handler, and waits for operation to finish. If there's an exception, it captures it and rethrows it.

Parameters:
c - the callable to post
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - on error

onInterrupted

protected void onInterrupted(java.lang.InterruptedException e)
Called when the thread has been interrupted, likely because the task was canceled. By default, calls onException(Exception), but this method may be overridden to handle interruptions differently than other exceptions.

Parameters:
e - the exception thrown from onPreExecute(), Callable.call(), or onSuccess(Object)

onException

protected void onException(java.lang.Exception e)
                    throws java.lang.RuntimeException

RuntimeException, - ignored
